Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 13.1 and σ = 0.6. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 15% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 12.3436
* 12.4147
* 12.4781
* 12.885

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 12.3436: Incorrect
* 12.4147: Incorrect
* 12.4781: Correct
* 12.885: Incorrect
